choices: (A) Obtener información no es el objetivo principal de la lectura.

Spanish.context: Al leer libros tradicionales en papel, el texto en sí no se mueve, lo que puede calmar a la gente. Sin embargo, al leer frente a la pantalla de una computadora, hacer clic con el mouse y desplazarse inevitablemente interrumpirá la atención de las personas, lo que dificultará la comprensión completa del texto y hará que las personas se impacienten. Además, los dedos tocan el papel y la pantalla para estimular el área perceptiva del cerebro también es completamente diferente. El primero es más útil para estimular el subconsciente de las personas y ayudarlas a comprender la belleza de las palabras, no solo para obtener información.

English.question: Which of the following options, if correct, best supports the company's view?
English.model_input:
Please answer the following multiple-choice question by selecting the correct option.

Context:
In recent years, there have been several serious traffic accidents in cars produced by a company, some people think that this is due to the design defects of cars. In response, the company strongly denied that the design was flawed, citing the analysis of the traffic accidents, which resulted in the driver's drink-driving or fatigued driving.

Question:
Which of the following options, if correct, best supports the company's view?

Choices:
(A) After testing the accident vehicle, no design defects were found
(B) The company has always claimed that its products have good safety performance
(C) Drinking and fatigue can seriously affect drivers' judgment when driving
(D) The traffic accident analysis report based on the company is true and reliable

Answer:
English.model_prediction:
The correct answer is (C) Drinking and fatigue can seriously affect drivers' judgment when driving.

The passage states that the company's analysis of the traffic accidents concluded that the design of the cars was not flawed. However, the passage also acknowledges that drinking and fatigue can seriously affect drivers' judgment, which could have contributed to the accidents.

English.answer: (A) A successful design must be able to show the characteristics of the product artistically
choices: (A) A successful design must be able to show the characteristics of the product artistically
(B) Commercial design should emphasize the relationship between advertising and products as much as possible
(C) Unique creativity is not an absolute element of commercial design
(D) For designers, attracting customers should be the first priority
English.context: Commercial design may be increasingly endowed with the value of artistic creation and appreciation, but its fundamental starting point and goal is always to show the characteristics of the product to customers in an artistic way. If a commercial design is not reminiscent of a product and likes it, no matter how exquisite and creative it is, it cannot be regarded as a successful design. In the final analysis, the most important thing about advertising besides creativity is relevance. We don't want to be attracted by a beautiful work, but we don't see any connection between it and the product we endorse.
English.question: Which of the following summarizes this passage most accurately?
English.model_input:
Please answer the following multiple-choice question by selecting the correct option.

Context:
Commercial design may be increasingly endowed with the value of artistic creation and appreciation, but its fundamental starting point and goal is always to show the characteristics of the product to customers in an artistic way. If a commercial design is not reminiscent of a product and likes it, no matter how exquisite and creative it is, it cannot be regarded as a successful design. In the final analysis, the most important thing about advertising besides creativity is relevance. We don't want to be attracted by a beautiful work, but we don't see any connection between it and the product we endorse.

Question:
Which of the following summarizes this passage most accurately?

Choices:
(A) A successful design must be able to show the characteristics of the product artistically
(B) Commercial design should emphasize the relationship between advertising and products as much as possible
(C) Unique creativity is not an absolute element of commercial design
(D) For designers, attracting customers should be the first priority

Answer:
English.model_prediction: The correct answer is (A) A successful design must be able to show the characteristics of the product artistically.

Filipino.answer: (A) Ang isang matagumpay na disenyo ay dapat na maipakita ang mga katangian ng produkto nang masining
choices: (A) Ang isang matagumpay na disenyo ay dapat na maipakita ang mga katangian ng produkto nang masining
(B) Dapat bigyang-diin ng komersyal na disenyo ang kaugnayan sa pagitan ng advertising at mga produkto hangga't maaari
(C) Ang natatanging pagkamalikhain ay hindi isang ganap na elemento ng komersyal na disenyo
(D) Para sa mga designer, ang pag-akit ng mga customer ay dapat ang unang priyoridad
Filipino.context: Ang komersyal na disenyo ay maaaring lalong pinagkalooban ng halaga ng masining na paglikha at pagpapahalaga, ngunit ang pangunahing panimulang punto at layunin nito ay palaging ipakita ang mga katangian ng produkto sa mga customer sa masining na paraan. Kung ang isang komersyal na disenyo ay hindi nakapagpapaalaala sa isang produkto at nagustuhan ito, gaano man ito kaganda at pagiging malikhain, hindi ito maaaring ituring na isang matagumpay na disenyo. Sa huling pagsusuri, ang pinakamahalagang bagay tungkol sa advertising bukod sa pagkamalikhain ay ang kaugnayan. Hindi namin gustong maakit sa isang magandang gawa, ngunit wala kaming nakikitang koneksyon sa pagitan nito at ng produktong ini-endorso namin.

Spanish.answer: (A) Un diseño exitoso debe ser capaz de mostrar artísticamente las características del producto.
choices: (A) Un diseño exitoso debe ser capaz de mostrar artísticamente las características del producto.
(B) El diseño comercial debe enfatizar al máximo la relación entre la publicidad y los productos.
(C) La creatividad única no es un elemento absoluto del diseño comercial.
(D) Para los diseñadores, atraer clientes debería ser la primera prioridad
Spanish.context: El diseño comercial puede estar cada vez más dotado del valor de creación y apreciación artística, pero su punto de partida y objetivo fundamental es siempre mostrar las características del producto a los clientes de forma artística. Si un diseño comercial no recuerda a un producto y le gusta, por muy exquisito y creativo que sea, no puede considerarse un diseño exitoso. En última instancia, lo más importante de la publicidad, además de la creatividad, es la relevancia. No queremos sentirnos atraídos por una obra hermosa, pero no vemos ninguna conexión entre ella y el producto que promocionamos.

Chinese.answer: (A) 成功的设计必须能够艺术地展现产品特质
choices: (A) 成功的设计必须能够艺术地展现产品特质

Chinese.context: 商业设计也许越来越被赋予艺术创作和欣赏的价值,但它根本的出发点和落脚点永远是把产品的特质用艺术的方式展现给顾客.如果一项商业设计不能让人联想到产品并对之产生好感,即使它再精美,再具创意,也不能算是成功的设计.说到底,广告在创意之外最重要的还是关联性,我们不想被一个美轮美奂的作品吸引,结果却看不出它与所代言的商品之间存在任何联系.

They are deprived of the information they need to make informed decisions because the press is ignoring substantive policy issues and reporting only on the process of the campaign. English.answer: (B) As long as the workload of the enterprise increases, the accident rate of skilled workers always increases
choices: (A) Companies that need to hire new people should strengthen vocational training
(B) As long as the workload of the enterprise increases, the accident rate of skilled workers always increases
(C) The injury rate in the construction industry is higher than that in the manufacturing industry
(D) When the load increases, the company hires unskilled workers only for temporary work
English.context: The research on the safety of construction and manufacturing industry shows that when the workload of enterprises increases, the industrial injury rate also increases. When the workload increases, enterprises always employ a large number of unskilled workers. There is no doubt that the increase of industrial injury rate is caused by the low efficiency of unskilled workers.

English.model_prediction: The correct answer is (B) As long as the workload of the enterprise increases, the accident rate of skilled workers always increases.

Indonesian.answer: (C) Jika tidak ada bahan tambahan yang digunakan, makanan dapat menyebabkan keracunan makanan akibat aksi mikroorganisme
choices: (A) Mengklaim bahwa tidak ada bahan tambahan makanan sering kali merupakan gimmick yang diciptakan oleh pelaku bisnis untuk memenuhi psikologi konsumen
(B) Bahan tambahan makanan sudah ada sejak peradaban manusia, seperti air garam yang digunakan untuk membuat tahu

Indonesian.context: Bahan tambahan makanan merupakan bagian penting dari industri makanan modern. Penggunaan bahan tambahan pangan sesuai peraturan tidak berbahaya bagi tubuh manusia, dapat meningkatkan mutu pangan, serta berperan sebagai antiseptik dan menjaga kesegaran. Justru karena perkembangan bahan tambahan makanan, sejumlah besar makanan ringan telah memberikan kemudahan yang besar bagi kehidupan masyarakat. Tanpa bahan tambahan makanan, sebagian besar makanan tidak sedap dipandang, tidak enak, sulit untuk dijaga kesegarannya, atau harganya mahal.

Please answer the following multiple-choice question by selecting the correct option.

Context:
Bahan tambahan makanan merupakan bagian penting dari industri makanan modern. Penggunaan bahan tambahan pangan sesuai peraturan tidak berbahaya bagi tubuh manusia, dapat meningkatkan mutu pangan, serta berperan sebagai antiseptik dan menjaga kesegaran. Justru karena perkembangan bahan tambahan makanan, sejumlah besar makanan ringan telah memberikan kemudahan yang besar bagi kehidupan masyarakat. Tanpa bahan tambahan makanan, sebagian besar makanan tidak sedap dipandang, tidak enak, sulit untuk dijaga kesegarannya, atau harganya mahal.

Question:
Jika salah satu pernyataan berikut ini benar, manakah pernyataan berikut yang paling mendukung kesimpulan di atas?

Choices:
(A) Mengklaim bahwa tidak ada bahan tambahan makanan sering kali merupakan gimmick yang diciptakan oleh pelaku bisnis untuk memenuhi psikologi konsumen
(B) Bahan tambahan makanan sudah ada sejak peradaban manusia, seperti air garam yang digunakan untuk membuat tahu
(C) Jika tidak ada bahan tambahan yang digunakan, makanan dapat menyebabkan keracunan makanan akibat aksi mikroorganisme
(D) Melamin juga merupakan bahan aditif yang dapat digunakan sebagai superplasticizer pada semen

Answer:
Indonesian.model_prediction:
**C. Jika tidak ada bahan tambahan yang digunakan, makanan dapat menyebabkan keracunan makanan akibat aksi mikroorganisme**

Penelitian telah menunjukkan bahwa bahan tambahan makanan, seperti bahan-bahan kimia, dapat menyebabkan keracunan makanan jika digunakan berlebihan.

English.answer: (C) If no additives are used, food can cause food poisoning due to the action of microorganisms
choices: (A) Claiming that there are no food additives is often a gimmick created by businesses to cater to consumers' psychology
(B) Food additives are as old as human civilization, such as the brine used to order tofu
(C) If no additives are used, food can cause food poisoning due to the action of microorganisms
(D) Melamine is also an additive, which can be used as a superplasticizer in cement
English.context: Food additives are an important part of the modern food industry. The use of food additives in accordance with regulations is harmless to the human body, and can improve the quality of food, and play the role of antiseptic and fresh-keeping. It is precisely because of the development of food additives that a large number of convenience foods have brought great convenience to people's lives. Without food additives, most foods are either unsightly, unpalatable or difficult to keep fresh, or are expensive.

English.model_input:

Context:

It is precisely because of the development of food additives that a large number of convenience foods have brought great convenience to people's lives. Without food additives, most foods are either unsightly, unpalatable or difficult to keep fresh, or are expensive.

Question:
If any of the followings is true, which of the followings best supports the above conclusion?

Choices:
(A) Claiming that there are no food additives is often a gimmick created by businesses to cater to consumers' psychology
(B) Food additives are as old as human civilization, such as the brine used to order tofu
(C) If no additives are used, food can cause food poisoning due to the action of microorganisms
(D) Melamine is also an additive, which can be used as a superplasticizer in cement

Answer:
English.model_prediction:
The correct answer is (C) If no additives are used, food can cause food poisoning due to the action of microorganisms.

The passage states that food additives are harmless to the human body and can improve the quality of food. However, the passage also warns that if no additives are used, food can cause food poisoning due to the action of microorganisms.

Filipino.answer: (C) Kung walang ginagamit na additives, ang pagkain ay maaaring magdulot ng food poisoning dahil sa pagkilos ng mga microorganism
choices: (A) Ang pag-aangkin na walang food additives ay kadalasang isang gimik na nilikha ng mga negosyo upang matugunan ang sikolohiya ng mga mamimili
(B) Ang mga additives ng pagkain ay kasingtanda ng sibilisasyon ng tao, tulad ng brine na ginagamit sa pag-order ng tofu
(C) Kung walang ginagamit na additives, ang pagkain ay maaaring magdulot ng food poisoning dahil sa pagkilos ng mga microorganism
(D) Ang melamine ay isang additive din, na maaaring magamit bilang isang superplasticizer sa semento
Filipino.context: Ang mga additives ng pagkain ay isang mahalagang bahagi ng modernong industriya ng pagkain. Ang paggamit ng mga additives ng pagkain alinsunod sa mga regulasyon ay hindi nakakapinsala sa katawan ng tao, at maaaring mapabuti ang kalidad ng pagkain, at gumaganap ng papel na antiseptiko at sariwang-iingat. Ito ay tiyak na dahil sa pag-unlad ng mga additives ng pagkain na ang isang malaking bilang ng mga convenience food ay nagdala ng malaking kaginhawahan sa buhay ng mga tao. Kung walang food additives, karamihan sa mga pagkain ay hindi maganda tingnan, hindi masarap o mahirap panatilihing sariwa, o mahal.

Spanish.answer: (C) Si no se utilizan aditivos, los alimentos pueden provocar intoxicación alimentaria por la acción de microorganismos.

(C) Si no se utilizan aditivos, los alimentos pueden provocar intoxicación alimentaria por la acción de microorganismos.
(D) La melamina también es un aditivo que se puede utilizar como superplastificante en el cemento.
Spanish.context: Los aditivos alimentarios son una parte importante de la industria alimentaria moderna. El uso de aditivos alimentarios de acuerdo con las regulaciones es inofensivo para el cuerpo humano, puede mejorar la calidad de los alimentos y desempeñar el papel de antiséptico y de conservación de la frescura. Precisamente gracias al desarrollo de aditivos alimentarios, una gran cantidad de alimentos preparados han aportado una gran comodidad a la vida de las personas. Sin aditivos alimentarios, la mayoría de los alimentos son antiestéticos, desagradables, difíciles de mantener frescos o caros.

English.answer: (D) Adults do not contract influenza primarily from children who have influenza.
choices: (A) The injectable vaccine is affordable for all adults.
(B) The nasal spray vaccine is most effective when administered to adults.
(C) Any person who has received the injectable vaccine can safely receive the nasal-spray vaccine as well.
(D) Adults do not contract influenza primarily from children who have influenza.
English.context: Until now, only injectable vaccines against influenza have been available. Parents are reluctant to subject children to the pain of injections, but adults, who are at risk of serious complications from influenza, are commonly vaccinated. A new influenza vaccine, administered painlessly in a nasal spray, is effective for children. However, since children seldom develop serious complications from influenza, no significant public health benefit would result from widespread vaccination of children using the nasal spray.

However, since children seldom develop serious complications from influenza, no significant public health benefit would result from widespread vaccination of children using the nasal spray.

Spanish.context: Hasta ahora, sólo se disponía de vacunas inyectables contra la gripe. Los padres son reacios a someter a sus hijos al dolor de las inyecciones, pero los adultos, que corren el riesgo de sufrir complicaciones graves por la influenza, suelen ser vacunados. Una nueva vacuna contra la influenza, administrada sin dolor en un aerosol nasal, es eficaz en los niños. Sin embargo, dado que los niños rara vez desarrollan complicaciones graves a causa de la influenza, no se obtendría ningún beneficio significativo para la salud pública de la vacunación generalizada de los niños utilizando el aerosol nasal.

English.answer: (C) Successful predictions of human behavior do not constitute an understanding of that behavior.

English.context: The purpose of the physical sciences is to predict the order in which events will succeed one another. Human behavior, also, can sometimes be successfully predicted. Question:

Ttherefore, the breakup of the hull can be ruled out as the cause of the sinking.

English.context: Studies have shown that there has been no significant warming trend in global average temperature in the past 15 years, which seems to be in contradiction with the general background of global warming caused by greenhouse gas emissions. But the temperature change is caused by the dynamic temperature and the radiation temperature. The study of climate effect should not only consider the interdecadal change of the dynamical factors of climate system, but also quantify the effect of radiation temperature caused by human activities. In fact, there has been a significant cooling trend in the power temperature over the last 15 years, while the radiation temperature has continued to rise, offsetting each other and causing global temperature stagnation in recent years.
English.question: Which of the following is true?
English.model_input:
Please answer the following multiple-choice question by selecting the correct option.

Context:
Studies have shown that there has been no significant warming trend in global average temperature in the past 15 years, which seems to be in contradiction with the general background of global warming caused by greenhouse gas emissions. But the temperature change is caused by the dynamic temperature and the radiation temperature. The study of climate effect should not only consider the interdecadal change of the dynamical factors of climate system, but also quantify the effect of radiation temperature caused by human activities. In fact, there has been a significant cooling trend in the power temperature over the last 15 years, while the radiation temperature has continued to rise, offsetting each other and causing global temperature stagnation in recent years.

Question:
Which of the following is true?

Choices:
(A) The increase in dynamic temperature and radiation temperature leads to the general trend of global warming.
(B) The temperature stability depends on the same variation of the dynamic temperature and the radiation temperature.
(C) The  obvious cooling of the dynamic climate contributed to global warming 15 years ago.
(D) The interdecadal change of the dynamical factors of the climate system Cools the atmospheric temperature.

Answer:
English.model_prediction:
The correct answer is (A) The increase in dynamic temperature and radiation temperature leads to the general trend of global warming.

English.answer: (D) The conflict between life and culture may give birth to a new culture.
choices: (A) Culture sometimes directly expresses the sense of tension and crisis of life.
(B) One of the functions of culture is to express life.

In one experiment, the first group ate a lot of artificial sugar, the second group did not eat sugar. It turns out that people who eat sugar have lower cognitive abilities than people who don't. The cognitive abilities of the two groups were equal before the experiment.

The correct answer is (C) Some of the ingredients in artificial sugar may affect people's cognitive abilities.

The experiment aims to investigate the potential impact of artificial sugar on cognitive abilities by comparing the cognitive performance of two groups of individuals who consume different amounts of artificial sugar.

English.answer: (A) The combustion of coal and oil will release a large amount of sulfur dioxide and nitrogen dioxide into the air.
choices: (A) The combustion of coal and oil will release a large amount of sulfur dioxide and nitrogen dioxide into the air.
(B) The expansion of acid rain area will consume a lot of coal and oil resources, leading to the occurrence of energy crisis.
(C) The gases emitted after the combustion of coal and oil combine with sulfur dioxide and nitrogen dioxide to form an acid.
(D) The oxidants released by the combustion of coal and oil combine sulfur dioxide and nitrogen dioxide to form an acid.
English.context: Acid rain usually refers to rain with pH value lower than 5.6. It does great harm to human health, ecological environment and construction facilities, and causes direct economic losses of tens of billions of dollars every year. It can be confirmed that sulfur dioxide and nitrogen dioxide in the atmosphere are the main substances forming acid rain. They form water-soluble acids under the action of oxidants in the air. Researchers have pointed out that reducing the use of coal and oil is the fundamental policy to prevent acid rain.
English.question: Which of the following is the premise for the judgment of the above researchers?
English.model_input:
Please answer the following multiple-choice question by selecting the correct option.

Context:
Acid rain usually refers to rain with pH value lower than 5.6. It does great harm to human health, ecological environment and construction facilities, and causes direct economic losses of tens of billions of dollars every year. It can be confirmed that sulfur dioxide and nitrogen dioxide in the atmosphere are the main substances forming acid rain. They form water-soluble acids under the action of oxidants in the air. Researchers have pointed out that reducing the use of coal and oil is the fundamental policy to prevent acid rain.

Question:
Which of the following is the premise for the judgment of the above researchers?

Choices:
(A) The combustion of coal and oil will release a large amount of sulfur dioxide and nitrogen dioxide into the air.
(B) The expansion of acid rain area will consume a lot of coal and oil resources, leading to the occurrence of energy crisis.
(C) The gases emitted after the combustion of coal and oil combine with sulfur dioxide and nitrogen dioxide to form an acid.
(D) The oxidants released by the combustion of coal and oil combine sulfur dioxide and nitrogen dioxide to form an acid.

Answer:
English.model_prediction:
The correct answer is (C) The gases emitted after the combustion of coal and oil combine with sulfur dioxide and nitrogen dioxide to form an acid.

The passage explains that the main substances forming acid rain are sulfur dioxide and nitrogen dioxide. It then states that these gases combine with oxidants in the air to form water-soluble acids.

The passage states that the main substances responsible for the formation of acid rain are sulfur dioxide (SO2) and nitrogen dioxide (NO2). These gases are produced by the combustion of fossil fuels, such as coal and oil, and are released into the atmosphere during the burning process. When these gases combine with water vapor in the atmosphere, they form sulfuric acid (H2SO4) and nitric acid (HNO3), which are the main components of acid rain.

English.answer: (D) Timing is the greatest secret to happiness in life

English.context: Once, Socrates and three students walked through a field of wheat, and he asked the students to walk over here to pick the largest ear of wheat. As a result, one student returned empty-handed. He always thought that the largest ear of wheat must still be in front. He didn't realize that the end of the wheat was still empty. Once, Socrates and three students walked through a field of wheat, and he asked the students to walk over here to pick the largest ear of wheat. As a result, one student returned empty-handed. English.answer: (C) Einstein's calculations through the theory of relativity are correct.
choices: (A) If humans cannot use the huge energy of antimatter, they cannot conduct interstellar exploration.
(B) There is only one universe.
(C) Einstein's calculations through the theory of relativity are correct.

English.context: Einstein's greatest contribution to mankind is the theory of relativity, which is a powerful tool for mankind to study the universe. Einstein used the theory of relativity to calculate the mass of the universe and found that the total mass of the universe turned out to be zero. Einstein believed that, The matter produced in the universe after the Big Bang has two forms, antimatter and positive matter are completely opposite, and the masses of positive and antimatter are equal. However, scientists have only found a small amount of antimatter in the universe, so where did most of the antimatter go? If they do not exist in the universe, Einstein will not find that the total mass of the universe is zero through the calculations of the theory of relativity. But the mass of the universe is zero, which shows that antimatter should still exist in the universe.

But the mass of the universe is zero, which shows that antimatter should still exist in the universe.

Filipino.context: Ang pinakamalaking kontribusyon ni Einstein sa sangkatauhan ay ang teorya ng relativity, na isang makapangyarihang kasangkapan para pag-aralan ng sangkatauhan ang uniberso. Ginamit ni Einstein ang teorya ng relativity upang kalkulahin ang masa ng uniberso at natagpuan na ang kabuuang masa ng uniberso ay naging zero. Naniniwala si Einstein na, Ang bagay na ginawa sa uniberso pagkatapos ng Big Bang ay may dalawang anyo, ang antimatter at positive matter ay ganap na magkasalungat, at ang masa ng positive at antimatter ay pantay. Gayunpaman, ang mga siyentipiko ay nakahanap lamang ng isang maliit na halaga ng antimatter sa uniberso, kaya saan napunta ang karamihan sa mga antimatter? Kung wala sila sa uniberso, hindi makikita ni Einstein na ang kabuuang masa ng uniberso ay zero sa pamamagitan ng mga kalkulasyon ng teorya ng relativity. Ngunit ang masa ng uniberso ay zero, na nagpapakita na ang antimatter ay dapat pa ring umiral sa uniberso.

Spanish.answer: (C) Los cálculos de Einstein a través de la teoría de la relatividad son correctos.
choices: (A) Si los humanos no pueden utilizar la enorme energía de la antimateria, no podrán realizar exploraciones interestelares.

Einstein utilizó la teoría de la relatividad para calcular la masa del universo y descubrió que la masa total del universo resultó ser cero. Einstein creía que la materia producida en el universo después del Big Bang tiene dos formas, la antimateria y la materia positiva son completamente opuestas, y las masas de la materia positiva y la antimateria son iguales. Si no existen en el universo, Einstein no encontrará que la masa total del universo es cero mediante los cálculos de la teoría de la relatividad. Pero la masa del universo es cero, lo que demuestra que la antimateria todavía debería existir en el universo.

Einstein menggunakan teori relativiti untuk mengira jisim alam semesta dan mendapati jumlah jisim alam semesta ternyata sifar. Einstein percaya bahawa, Jirim yang dihasilkan di alam semesta selepas Big Bang mempunyai dua bentuk, antijirim dan jirim positif adalah bertentangan sama sekali, dan jisim positif dan antijirim adalah sama. Walau bagaimanapun, saintis hanya menemui sejumlah kecil antijirim di alam semesta, jadi ke manakah perginya kebanyakan antijirim tersebut? Jika ia tidak wujud di alam semesta, Einstein pastinya tidak akan mendapati bahawa jumlah jisim alam semesta adalah sifar melalui pengiraan teori relativiti. Tetapi jisim alam semesta adalah sifar, yang menunjukkan bahawa antijirim masih sepatutnya wujud di alam semesta.

English.answer: (A) The government must continue to implement the policies it has formulated
choices: (A) The government must continue to implement the policies it has formulated
(B) The government's ability to regulate and control the macro economy
(C) Factors that must be considered when formulating economic policies

English.context: Every time the government introduces an economic policy, it will change the income expectations of some interest groups. Out of self-interest, these interest groups always try to offset the loss caused by the policy through various behavior choices. At this time, if the government really changes the original policy, the result will not only invalidate the policy issued by the government, but also make the government's ability of economic regulation and control decline continuously due to the loss of credibility.

English.answer: (B) Life on earth may originally originated from clay
choices: (A) Protective effect of hydrogel on biochemical reactions
(B) Life on earth may originally originated from clay
(C) The role of clay in the origin of life on earth
(D) Clay is rich in nutrients needed for life
English.context: Clay may seem like a less fertile, more mineral mixture, but it may be the birthplace of life on Earth. In simulated ancient sea water, clay forms hydrogels-made up of tiny spaces (like sponges) that absorb liquids. Over the past billions of years, chemicals trapped in these spaces may have undergone complex reactions, forming proteins, deoxyribonucleic acids and systems that eventually form living bubbles. The hydrogels formed by clay may imprison and protect the above chemical processes until the cell membrane enclosing living vesicles is developed.
English.question: Which of the following is the main content of this text?
English.model_input:
Please answer the following multiple-choice question by selecting the correct option.

Context:
Clay may seem like a less fertile, more mineral mixture, but it may be the birthplace of life on Earth. In simulated ancient sea water, clay forms hydrogels-made up of tiny spaces (like sponges) that absorb liquids. Over the past billions of years, chemicals trapped in these spaces may have undergone complex reactions, forming proteins, deoxyribonucleic acids and systems that eventually form living bubbles. The hydrogels formed by clay may imprison and protect the above chemical processes until the cell membrane enclosing living vesicles is developed.

Spanish.answer: (B) La vida en la Tierra puede originarse originalmente a partir de arcilla.
choices: (A) Efecto protector del hidrogel sobre reacciones bioquímicas.

(D) La arcilla es rica en nutrientes necesarios para la vida.
Spanish.context: La arcilla puede parecer una mezcla menos fértil y más mineral, pero puede ser el lugar de nacimiento de la vida en la Tierra. En agua de mar antigua simulada, la arcilla forma hidrogeles, formados por espacios diminutos (como esponjas) que absorben líquidos. Durante los últimos miles de millones de años, las sustancias químicas atrapadas en estos espacios pueden haber sufrido reacciones complejas, formando proteínas, ácidos desoxirribonucleicos y sistemas que eventualmente forman burbujas vivas. Los hidrogeles formados por la arcilla pueden aprisionar y proteger los procesos químicos anteriores hasta que se desarrolle la membrana celular que encierra las vesículas vivas.

Chinese.answer: (B) 地球生命可能起源于粘土
choices: (A) 水凝胶对生化反应的保护作用

Chinese.context: 粘土可能看起来像是一种不那么肥沃、富含矿物质的混合物，但它可能是地球上生命的发源地。在模拟的古代海水中，粘土形成水凝胶-由吸收液体的微小空间（如海绵）组成。在过去的数十亿年中，困在这些空间中的化学物质可能经历了复杂的反应，形成蛋白质、脱氧核糖核酸和最终形成活气泡的系统。粘土形成的水凝胶可能会禁锢和保护上述化学过程，直到包裹活囊泡的细胞膜发育完成。

Chinese.model_prediction:

Indonesian.answer: (A) Aktivitas manusia merupakan penyebab utama terjadinya pemanasan global

Indonesian.context: Para ilmuwan percaya bahwa penyerapan karbon dioksida dari atmosfer oleh lautan untuk sementara mengurangi peningkatan konsentrasi karbon dioksida, dan ketika penurunan tersebut berakhir, konsentrasi karbon dioksida di atmosfer akan meningkat lebih cepat. Jadi apakah peningkatan karbon dioksida akan menyebabkan kenaikan suhu atmosfer? Meskipun sebagian besar ilmuwan percaya bahwa jawabannya adalah ya, hal ini merupakan proses yang panjang dengan banyak variabel, dan para skeptis terhadap perubahan iklim telah berusaha meyakinkan masyarakat bahwa tingkat karbon dioksida tidak selalu berhubungan dengan suhu atmosfer. Strategi ini sangat efektif sehingga banyak orang masih menolak untuk percaya bahwa aktivitas manusia menyebabkan pemanasan global dan oleh karena itu menolak untuk berpartisipasi dalam pengurangan emisi.

English.answer: (A) Human activities are the main cause of global warming
choices: (A) Human activities are the main cause of global warming
(B) The oceans are becoming less capable of absorbing carbon dioxide
(C) Climate change has little to do with co2 concentrations
(D) Human activity can lead to an increase in carbon dioxide concentrations
English.context: Scientists believe that the absorption of carbon dioxide from the atmosphere by the oceans temporarily eased the rise in carbon dioxide concentrations, and that once the relief lapses, atmospheric carbon dioxide concentrations will increase even faster. So will the increased carbon dioxide lead to a rise in atmospheric temperatures? Although most scientists believe the answer is yes, it is a long process with many variables, and climate change skeptics have been trying to convince the public that carbon dioxide levels are not necessarily related to atmospheric temperature. This strategy was so effective that many people still refuse to believe that human activity is causing global warming and therefore refuse to participate in reducing emissions.

So will the increased carbon dioxide lead to a rise in atmospheric temperatures? Although most scientists believe the answer is yes, it is a long process with many variables, and climate change skeptics have been trying to convince the public that carbon dioxide levels are not necessarily related to atmospheric temperature. This strategy was so effective that many people still refuse to believe that human activity is causing global warming and therefore refuse to participate in reducing emissions.

Question:

Choices:
(A) Human activities are the main cause of global warming
(B) The oceans are becoming less capable of absorbing carbon dioxide
(C) Climate change has little to do with co2 concentrations
(D) Human activity can lead to an increase in carbon dioxide concentrations

Answer:
English.model_prediction:
The correct answer is (B) The oceans are becoming less capable of absorbing carbon dioxide.

The passage states that scientists believe that the absorption of carbon dioxide from the atmosphere by the oceans temporarily eased the rise in carbon dioxide concentrations. However, skeptics argue that the oceans are becoming less capable of absorbing carbon dioxide due to factors such as pollution and climate change.

Filipino.answer: (A) Ang mga gawain ng tao ang pangunahing sanhi ng global warming
choices: (A) Ang mga gawain ng tao ang pangunahing sanhi ng global warming

(C) Ang pagbabago ng klima ay walang gaanong kinalaman sa mga konsentrasyon ng co2
(D) Ang aktibidad ng tao ay maaaring humantong sa pagtaas ng mga konsentrasyon ng carbon dioxide
Filipino.context: Naniniwala ang mga siyentipiko na ang pagsipsip ng carbon dioxide mula sa atmospera ng mga karagatan ay pansamantalang nagpapagaan sa pagtaas ng mga konsentrasyon ng carbon dioxide, at na kapag nawala ang relief, ang mga konsentrasyon ng carbon dioxide sa atmospera ay tataas nang mas mabilis. Kaya ang tumaas na carbon dioxide ay hahantong sa pagtaas ng temperatura sa atmospera? Bagama't ang karamihan sa mga siyentipiko ay naniniwala na ang sagot ay oo, ito ay isang mahabang proseso na may maraming mga variable, at ang mga nag-aalinlangan sa pagbabago ng klima ay sinusubukang kumbinsihin ang publiko na ang mga antas ng carbon dioxide ay hindi kinakailangang nauugnay sa temperatura ng atmospera. Napakabisa ng diskarteng ito kaya marami pa ring tao ang tumatangging maniwala na ang aktibidad ng tao ay nagdudulot ng global warming at samakatuwid ay tumatangging lumahok sa pagbabawas ng mga emisyon.

Spanish.answer: (A) Las actividades humanas son la principal causa del calentamiento global
choices: (A) Las actividades humanas son la principal causa del calentamiento global
(B) Los océanos son cada vez menos capaces de absorber dióxido de carbono
(C) El cambio climático tiene poco que ver con las concentraciones de co2
(D) La actividad humana puede provocar un aumento de las concentraciones de dióxido de carbono
Spanish.context: Los científicos creen que la absorción de dióxido de carbono de la atmósfera por los océanos alivió temporalmente el aumento de las concentraciones de dióxido de carbono, y que una vez que pase el alivio, las concentraciones de dióxido de carbono atmosférico aumentarán aún más rápido. Entonces, ¿el aumento de dióxido de carbono conducirá a un aumento de las temperaturas atmosféricas? Aunque la mayoría de los científicos creen que la respuesta es sí, es un proceso largo con muchas variables, y los escépticos del cambio climático han estado tratando de convencer al público de que los niveles de dióxido de carbono no están necesariamente relacionados con la temperatura atmosférica. Esta estrategia fue tan efectiva que muchas personas todavía se niegan a creer que la actividad humana esté causando el calentamiento global y, por lo tanto, se niegan a participar en la reducción de emisiones.

Walaupun kebanyakan saintis percaya jawapannya adalah ya, ia merupakan proses yang panjang dengan banyak pembolehubah, dan skeptik perubahan iklim sedang cuba meyakinkan orang ramai bahawa paras karbon dioksida tidak semestinya berkaitan dengan suhu atmosfera. Spanish.answer: (D) Explica por qué la creatividad de la industria televisiva se centra en el guionista.

Spanish.context: A diferencia de las películas donde la creatividad se centra en el director, el centro de la creatividad en la industria de la televisión es el guionista. La razón por la que los guionistas son importantes en la industria de la televisión es que el arte del lenguaje es especialmente importante cuando el pequeño marco de una imagen no tiene tanto espacio para el juego visual. El melodrama tiene como atractivo las historias, mientras que los programas de comedia se basan enteramente en la actuación de los actores y el encanto del lenguaje; todos están filmados en el cobertizo, lo cual es puramente técnico en términos de rodaje y la creatividad existe en el diálogo y la interpretación.

Indonesian.context: Dengan suhu yang tinggi dan panas di musim panas, air menjadi kebutuhan untuk meredakan panasnya musim panas. Namun bagi pengendara motor, minuman yang terlalu lama di dalam gerbong yang panas dan pengap berpotensi menimbulkan ancaman kesehatan. Botol minuman berbahan plastik aman digunakan sekali pakai dan berisiko terkena kanker jika digunakan kembali. Botol minuman ini dapat disimpan pada suhu ruangan dalam waktu yang lama, namun jika terkena sinar matahari, bahan tersebut akan menua dan melepaskan zat beracun, dan orang akan mengalami reaksi toksik kronis seperti mual dan muntah setelah meminum minuman di dalam botol.

Indonesian.answer: (B) Otak manusia mempunyai kelebihan yang tidak dimiliki komputer

(C) Melupakan adalah kelebihan otak manusia
(D) Falibilitas adalah anugerah luar biasa dari otak manusia
Indonesian.context: Perbedaan otak dan komputer ada dua, yang satu mudah lupa, yang lain mudah melakukan kesalahan. Hal ini tampaknya merupakan suatu kelemahan, namun sebenarnya merupakan suatu keuntungan. Lupa terjadi secara otomatis, yang memungkinkan kita membersihkan kelebihan informasi tanpa usaha, memberikan ruang bagi ide-ide bagus yang tidak terduga. Jika tidak ada ruang seperti itu, ide-ide bagus akan hilang dalam kegelapan karena tidak dapat menemukan habitat. Menjalin hubungan yang menjadi salah adalah anugerah luar biasa dari otak manusia, yang dengannya kita sering kali membuat penemuan yang tak terduga dan menemukan ide-ide baru yang tidak ada hubungannya. Kedua perbedaan ini menggambarkan hal yang sama, yaitu kemampuan komputer hanya sebatas informasi, sedangkan kemampuan otak manusia membiarkan informasi mengarah pada pemikiran.

English.answer: (B) The human brain has advantages that computers do not have
choices: (A) The ability of computers can easily lead to the idea that computers are superior to human brains
(B) The human brain has advantages that computers do not have
(C) Forgetting is the advantage of the human brain
(D) Fallibility is a wonderful gift of the human brain
English.context: There are two differences between brain and computer, one is easy to forget, the other is easy to make mistakes. This seems to be a disadvantage, but in fact it is an advantage. Forgetting happens automatically, which allows us to clear out excess information without effort, making room for unexpected good ideas. If there is no such space, good ideas will fly into the dark because they can't find habitat. Making relationships go wrong is a wonderful gift of the human brain, with which we often make unexpected discoveries and encounter new ideas where there is no connection. These two differences illustrate the same thing, that is, the ability of the computer is only up to information, while the ability of the human brain is to let information lead to thought.

These two differences illustrate the same thing, that is, the ability of the computer is only up to information, while the ability of the human brain is to let information lead to thought.

The paragraph emphasizes that the human brain's ability to forget allows us to clear out excess information and make room for unexpected good ideas. This ability is a significant advantage that enables us to discover new concepts and explore different possibilities.

Filipino.answer: (B) Ang utak ng tao ay may mga pakinabang na wala sa mga kompyuter
choices: (A) Ang kakayahan ng mga computer ay madaling humantong sa ideya na ang mga computer ay mas mataas kaysa sa utak ng tao
(B) Ang utak ng tao ay may mga pakinabang na wala sa mga kompyuter
(C) Ang paglimot ay ang bentahe ng utak ng tao
(D) Ang kamalian ay isang kahanga-hangang regalo ng utak ng tao
Filipino.context: Mayroong dalawang pagkakaiba sa pagitan ng utak at computer, ang isa ay madaling makalimutan, ang isa ay madaling magkamali. Ito ay tila isang kawalan, ngunit sa katunayan ito ay isang kalamangan. Awtomatikong nangyayari ang pagkalimot, na nagbibigay-daan sa amin na alisin ang labis na impormasyon nang walang pagsisikap, na nagbibigay ng puwang para sa hindi inaasahang magagandang ideya. Kung walang ganoong espasyo, ang magagandang ideya ay lilipad sa dilim dahil hindi sila makahanap ng tirahan. Ang pagkakamali sa mga relasyon ay isang magandang regalo ng utak ng tao, kung saan madalas tayong nakakagawa ng mga hindi inaasahang pagtuklas at nakakatagpo ng mga bagong ideya kung saan walang koneksyon. Ang dalawang pagkakaibang ito ay naglalarawan ng parehong bagay, iyon ay, ang kakayahan ng computer ay hanggang sa impormasyon lamang, habang ang kakayahan ng utak ng tao ay hayaan ang impormasyon na humantong sa pag-iisip.

Spanish.answer: (B) El cerebro humano tiene ventajas que las computadoras no tienen
choices: (A) La capacidad de las computadoras puede llevar fácilmente a la idea de que las computadoras son superiores al cerebro humano.
(B) El cerebro humano tiene ventajas que las computadoras no tienen
(C) Olvidar es la ventaja del cerebro humano
(D) La falibilidad es un maravilloso regalo del cerebro humano.
Spanish.context: Hay dos diferencias entre el cerebro y la computadora: una es fácil de olvidar y la otra es fácil de cometer errores. Esto parece ser una desventaja, pero en realidad es una ventaja. El olvido ocurre automáticamente, lo que nos permite eliminar el exceso de información sin esfuerzo, dejando espacio para buenas ideas inesperadas. Si no existe ese espacio, las buenas ideas volarán hacia la oscuridad porque no pueden encontrar un hábitat. Hacer que las relaciones salgan mal es un maravilloso regalo del cerebro humano, con el que a menudo hacemos descubrimientos inesperados y encontramos nuevas ideas donde no hay conexión. Estas dos diferencias ilustran lo mismo, es decir, la capacidad de la computadora sólo depende de la información, mientras que la capacidad del cerebro humano es dejar que la información conduzca al pensamiento.

Chinese.answer: (B) 人脑有着电脑所没有的优越性
choices: (A) 电脑的本领易使人们产生电脑优于人脑的想法
(B) 人脑有着电脑所没有的优越性
(C) 遗忘是人脑的优点
(D) 易出错是人脑的美妙天赋
Chinese.context: 脑与电脑的区别有二,一是容易遗忘,二是容易出错.这看起来是缺点,其实是优点.遗忘是自动发生的,这使我们可以不费力气就把多余的信息清除出去,给不期而至的好思想腾出空间.倘若没有这样的空间,好思想就会因为找不到栖息地而又飞向黑暗之中.让关系出错更是人脑的一个美妙天赋,靠了它我们往往会有意外的发现,在没有关联之处邂逅崭新的思想.这两个区别说明了同一件事,便是电脑的本领仅到信息为止,人脑的本领却是要让信息导致思想.

choices: (A) Khả năng của máy tính dễ dẫn đến quan điểm cho rằng máy tính vượt trội hơn bộ não con người

Vietnamese.context: Có hai điểm khác biệt giữa bộ não và máy tính, một là dễ quên, hai là dễ mắc lỗi. Điều này tưởng chừng như là một bất lợi nhưng thực chất lại là một lợi thế. Việc quên xảy ra một cách tự động, điều này cho phép chúng ta loại bỏ thông tin dư thừa mà không cần nỗ lực, nhường chỗ cho những ý tưởng hay bất ngờ. The clock, for example, made possible the synchronization of human affairs, which resulted in an increase in productivity. At the same time that the clock opened up some avenues, it closed others. It has become harder and harder to live except by the clock, so that now people have no choice in the matter at all.

Question:
Which one of the following propositions is best illustrated by the example presented in the passage?

Choices:
(A) Most new machines and technologies make our lives more synchronized and productive.
(B) Some new machines and technologies bring no improvement to our lives.
(C) New machines and technologies can enslave as well as liberate us.
(D) People should make a concerted effort to free themselves from the clock.

Answer:
English.model_prediction:
The correct answer is (A) Most new machines and technologies make our lives more synchronized and productive.

The passage explains how the clock initially opened up new avenues for human affairs, but it also closed others. This shows that not all new machines and technologies are beneficial, and that some can actually make our lives more difficult.

Please answer the following multiple-choice question by selecting the correct option.

Context:
Ang dean ng computing ay dapat na igalang ng mga akademikong kawani at may kakayahang pangasiwaan ang paggamit ng mga kompyuter sa kampus. Ang tanging mga dean na iginagalang ng mga akademya ay ang mga may hawak na digring doktor, at tanging isang taong talagang may alam tungkol sa mga computer ang maaaring mahusay na mangasiwa sa paggamit ng mga computer sa campus. Higit pa rito, ang board of trustees ay nagpasya na ang dean ng computing ay dapat mapili mula sa mga kawani ng unibersidad. Samakatuwid, ang dean ng computing ay dapat na isang propesor mula sa departamento ng computer science sa unibersidad.

Question:
Alin sa mga sumusunod ang isang palagay kung saan nakasalalay ang argumento?

Choices:
(A) Ang lahat ng akademya na mayroong mga digri ng doktor ay iginagalang ng kanilang mga kasamahan sa akademya.
(B) Iginagalang lamang ng mga akademya ang mga taong may hawak na digri ng doktor.
(C) Sa mga miyembro ng kawani ng unibersidad na ito na may mga digri ng doktor, ang mga nasa departamento ng agham ng kompyuter lamang ang talagang nakakaalam tungkol sa mga kompyuter.
(D) Sa unibersidad na ito, alam talaga ng bawat propesor na mayroong doctoral degree sa computer science ang tungkol sa kompyuter.

Answer:
Filipino.model_prediction:
The correct answer is (B) Iginagalang lamang ng mga akademya ang mga taong may hawak na digri ng doktor.

The passage states that the dean of computing is required to be a doctor of philosophy (doctor of philosophy or PhD) in computer science.

English.context: Hunger marketing means that commodity suppliers deliberately reduce their output in order to regulate the relationship between supply and demand, create the illusion of short supply, and maintain a high selling price and profit margin of commodities. Hunger marketing is more suitable for industries with high unit price and difficult to form repeated purchase of single commodities.
English.question: According to the above definition, which of the followings belongs to hunger marketing:
English.model_input:
Please answer the following multiple-choice question by selecting the correct option.

Context:
Hunger marketing means that commodity suppliers deliberately reduce their output in order to regulate the relationship between supply and demand, create the illusion of short supply, and maintain a high selling price and profit margin of commodities. Hunger marketing is more suitable for industries with high unit price and difficult to form repeated purchase of single commodities.

Question:
According to the above definition, which of the followings belongs to hunger marketing:

Choices:
(A) A classic white ball shoes of a brand has been selling steadily. Recently, affected by the nostalgic wind in the fashion industry, the sales of white ball shoes have increased greatly, and the supply is in short supply
(B) A manufacturer has designed a new notebook computer, which is far from the consistent style of the brand in the past. The manufacturer is not sure whether it can be accepted by the market. It has limited the production of 30000 sets. After listing, the market reaction is very hot and the supply exceeds the demand
(C) Recently, the top grade Baijiu is not saleable, and a well-known brand Baijiu manufacturer has taken the initiative to limit production and raise the price to ensure the efficiency.Sales did not decline significantly
(D) When an automobile brand launched a new model, many people lined up and even were willing to increase the price. The manufacturer claimed that the output of the car was limited and had been limited to sales in order to expand the impact of hot sales

Answer:
English.model_prediction:
The correct answer is (C) Recently, the top grade Baijiu is not saleable, and a well-known brand Baijiu manufacturer has taken the initiative to limit production and raise the price to ensure the efficiency.Sales did not decline significantly.

The passage describes how a manufacturer of Baijiu is taking the initiative to limit production and raise the price to ensure the efficiency.

Filipino.answer: (D) Nang ang isang tatak ng sasakyan ay naglunsad ng isang bagong modelo, maraming tao ang pumila at kahit na handang taasan ang presyo. Sinabi ng tagagawa na ang output ng kotse ay limitado at limitado sa mga benta upang mapalawak ang epekto ng mainit na benta
choices: (A) Ang isang klasikong puting ball shoes ng isang brand ay patuloy na nagbebenta. Kamakailan, naapektuhan ng nostalgic na hangin sa industriya ng fashion, ang mga benta ng puting ball shoes ay tumaas nang malaki, at ang supply ay kumulang sa supply

(B) Ang isang tagagawa ay nagdisenyo ng isang bagong notebook computer, na malayo sa pare-parehong istilo ng tatak sa nakaraan. Ang tagagawa ay hindi sigurado kung maaari itong tanggapin ng merkado. Nilimitahan nito ang produksyon ng 30000 set. Pagkatapos ng listahan, ang reaksyon sa merkado ay napakainit at ang supply ay lumampas sa demand

(C) Kamakailan, ang pinakamataas na baitang Baijiu ay hindi mabebenta, at ang isang kilalang tatak na tagagawa ng Baijiu ay nagsagawa ng inisyatiba upang limitahan ang produksyon at itaas ang presyo upang matiyak ang kahusayan. Ang mga benta ay hindi bumaba nang malaki

(D) Nang ang isang tatak ng sasakyan ay naglunsad ng isang bagong modelo, maraming tao ang pumila at kahit na handang taasan ang presyo. Sinabi ng tagagawa na ang output ng kotse ay limitado at limitado sa mga benta upang mapalawak ang epekto ng mainit na benta

Dalawa sa mga lungsod ay may medyo matatag na populasyon, at para sa kanila ang mga pagtatantya ng kasalukuyang populasyon at ng inaasahang populasyon sa loob ng limang taon ay bahagyang nag-iiba mula sa bawat kumpanya. Gayunpaman, para sa ikatlong lungsod, na mabilis na lumalago, ang mga pagtatantya ay nag-iiba-iba sa bawat kumpanya.

(D) Mas mahirap tantiyahin ang populasyon ng mga lungsod na may katamtamang laki kaysa sa mas maliliit na lungsod.

Answer:

Indonesian.context: Saat ini, kenaikan suhu air laut telah memicu serangkaian peristiwa pemutihan karang. Para peneliti sangat khawatir dengan nasib karang global. Ketika suhu air laut yang tinggi menyebabkan terumbu karang mengeluarkan alga simbiosis yang disebut zooxanthellae, karang yang kehilangan warna alga tersebut lambat laun berubah menjadi putih, dan terjadilah albinisme. Jika albinisme terus berlanjut, satu-satunya hal yang menunggu terumbu karang adalah kematian.

English.answer: (C) Limiting the rise in atmospheric temperature will at least leave coral reefs some time to adapt.
choices: (A) Global warming has led to the calcification of offshore coral reef systems more and more slowly.
(B) Rising temperatures and pressures cause shallow coral to seek refuge in deeper waters.
(C) Limiting the rise in atmospheric temperature will at least leave coral reefs some time to adapt.
(D) The continuous rise of temperature will lead to the longer and longer interval of albino events.
English.context: At present, the rise of sea water temperature has triggered a series of bleaching events. Researchers are very worried about the fate of global corals. Researchers have found that zooxanthellae can use photosynthesis to produce nutrients required by themselves and their hosts. When the high temperature sea water causes coral reefs to discharge symbiotic algae called zooxanthellae, corals that lose color algae gradually turn white, and albinism occurs. If albinism continues, the only thing waiting for the coral reef is death.
English.question: From this, which of the following can be inferred?

Context:
At present, the rise of sea water temperature has triggered a series of bleaching events. Researchers are very worried about the fate of global corals. Researchers have found that zooxanthellae can use photosynthesis to produce nutrients required by themselves and their hosts. When the high temperature sea water causes coral reefs to discharge symbiotic algae called zooxanthellae, corals that lose color algae gradually turn white, and albinism occurs. If albinism continues, the only thing waiting for the coral reef is death.

Question:
From this, which of the following can be inferred?

Choices:
(A) Global warming has led to the calcification of offshore coral reef systems more and more slowly.
(B) Rising temperatures and pressures cause shallow coral to seek refuge in deeper waters.
(C) Limiting the rise in atmospheric temperature will at least leave coral reefs some time to adapt.
(D) The continuous rise of temperature will lead to the longer and longer interval of albino events.

Answer:
English.model_prediction:
The correct answer is (D) The continuous rise of temperature will lead to the longer and longer interval of albino events.

The passage states that the rise of sea water temperature has triggered a series of bleaching events, and that corals that lose color algae gradually turn white and eventually experience albinism. Therefore, it can be inferred that the continuous rise of temperature will lead to the longer and longer interval of albino events.

Filipino.answer: (C) Ang paglilimita sa pagtaas ng temperatura sa atmospera ay mag-iiwan ng ilang oras upang umangkop ang mga coral reef.
choices: (A) Ang global warming ay humantong sa pag-calcification ng mga offshore coral reef system nang mas mabagal.
(B) Ang tumataas na temperatura at pressure ay nagiging sanhi ng mga mababaw na coral upang maghanap ng kanlungan sa mas malalim na tubig.
(C) Ang paglilimita sa pagtaas ng temperatura sa atmospera ay mag-iiwan ng ilang oras upang umangkop ang mga coral reef.
(D) Ang patuloy na pagtaas ng temperatura ay hahantong sa mas mahabang pagitan ng mga pagkaroon ng albinism.
Filipino.context: Sa kasalukuyan, ang pagtaas ng temperatura ng tubig sa dagat ay nag-trigger ng isang serye ng mga kaganapan sa pagpapaputi. Ang mga mananaliksik ay labis na nag-aalala tungkol sa kapalaran ng mga pandaigdigang korales. Natuklasan ng mga mananaliksik na ang zooxanthellae ay maaaring gumamit ng photosynthesis upang makagawa ng mga sustansyang kailangan ng kanilang sarili at ng kanilang mga host. Kapag ang mataas na temperatura ng tubig sa dagat ay nagiging sanhi ng pagpapalabas ng mga coral reef ng symbiotic algae na tinatawag na zooxanthellae, ang mga coral na nawawalan ng kulay na algae ay unti-unting pumuputi, at nangyayari ang albinism. Kung magpapatuloy ang albinism, ang tanging naghihintay sa coral reef ay kamatayan.

Spanish.answer: (C) Limitar el aumento de la temperatura atmosférica al menos dejará a los arrecifes de coral algo de tiempo para adaptarse.
choices: (A) El calentamiento global ha provocado una calcificación cada vez más lenta de los sistemas de arrecifes de coral marinos.
(B) El aumento de las temperaturas y las presiones hace que los corales poco profundos busquen refugio en aguas más profundas.
(C) Limitar el aumento de la temperatura atmosférica al menos dejará a los arrecifes de coral algo de tiempo para adaptarse.
(D) El aumento continuo de la temperatura conducirá a un intervalo cada vez más largo de eventos albinos.
Spanish.context: En la actualidad, el aumento de la temperatura del agua del mar ha desencadenado una serie de fenómenos de blanqueamiento. Los investigadores están muy preocupados por el destino de los corales en el mundo. Los investigadores han descubierto que las zooxantelas pueden utilizar la fotosíntesis para producir los nutrientes que necesitan ellas y sus huéspedes. Cuando el agua de mar a alta temperatura hace que los arrecifes de coral liberen algas simbióticas llamadas zooxantelas, los corales que pierden el color de las algas se vuelven blancos gradualmente y se produce albinismo. Si el albinismo continúa, lo único que le espera al arrecife de coral es la muerte.

Indonesian.answer: (A) Para ilmuwan-ilmuwan membandingkan gaya hidup dan karakteristik kepribadian penderita-penderita tumor ganas dengan orang sehat untuk mengetahui faktor risiko pemicu timbulnya tumor.
choices: (A) Para ilmuwan-ilmuwan membandingkan gaya hidup dan karakteristik kepribadian penderita-penderita tumor ganas dengan orang sehat untuk mengetahui faktor risiko pemicu timbulnya tumor.

(C) Para ilmuwan-ilmuwan menggunakan imunoterapi untuk mencoba mengubah sel-sel T kekebalan yang tidak berefek terhadap sel-sel tumor dan membuat mereka kembali ke medan perang
(D) Para ilmuwan-ilmuwan menggunakan tikus untuk menguji dan menyuntikkan protein abnormal tumor yang diekstraksi ke tikus sebagai vaksin untuk merangsang dan meningkatkan respons kekebalan mereka
Indonesian.context: Akibat mutasi gen, sel berkembang biak dan berdiferensiasi secara tidak terkendali, dan akhirnya berkembang menjadi tumor-tumor ganas. Ada banyak protein-protein abnormal yang dikodekan oleh gen-gen mutan pada permukaan sel-sel kanker. Masuk akal untuk dikatakan bahwa protein-protein abnormal ini harus dikenali oleh sistem kekebalan tubuh pada waktunya, dan memicu respons imun untuk menghilangkan sel kanker dalam satu pukulan. Namun karena pesatnya perkembangan sel tumor, mereka sangat pandai berkamuflase, apalagi mereka terus bermutasi. Di hadapan sel-sel tumor yang ganas dan banyak akal, sel-sel kekebalan yang semula kuat tampaknya tidak mampu dan bahkan menutup mata terhadap beberapa sel-sel tumor. Imunosupresi yang terbentuk di lingkungan mikro tumor membuat sistem kekebalan tubuh lumpuh.

English.answer: (A) Scientists compare the lifestyle and personality characteristics of patients with malignant tumors with those of healthy people to find out the risk factors inducing tumor incidence
choices: (A) Scientists compare the lifestyle and personality characteristics of patients with malignant tumors with those of healthy people to find out the risk factors inducing tumor incidence
(B) The researchers sequenced the DNA of tumor cells and healthy cells of each patient to identify tumor specific mutations and identify related abnormal proteins
(C) Scientists use immunotherapy to try to transform immune T cells that are indifferent to tumor cells and make them return to the battlefield
(D) Scientists used mice to test and injected the extracted tumor abnormal protein into mice as a vaccine to stimulate and enhance their immune response
English.context: Due to gene mutation, cells proliferate and differentiate uncontrollably, and eventually develop into malignant tumors. There are many abnormal proteins encoded by mutant genes on the surface of cancer cells. It is reasonable to say that these abnormal proteins should be recognized by the body's immune system in time, and trigger an immune response to remove cancer cells at one stroke. However, due to the rapid development of tumor cells, they are very good at camouflage, Moreover, it is constantly mutated. In the face of fierce and resourceful tumor cells, the originally powerful immune cells seem to be unable and even turn a blind eye to some tumor cells. The immunosuppression formed in the tumor microenvironment makes the immune system paralyzed.
English.question: According to the above information, which of the following studies may contribute to the development of effective antitumor drugs?
English.model_input:
Please answer the following multiple-choice question by selecting the correct option.

Context:
Due to gene mutation, cells proliferate and differentiate uncontrollably, and eventually develop into malignant tumors. There are many abnormal proteins encoded by mutant genes on the surface of cancer cells. It is reasonable to say that these abnormal proteins should be recognized by the body's immune system in time, and trigger an immune response to remove cancer cells at one stroke. However, due to the rapid development of tumor cells, they are very good at camouflage, Moreover, it is constantly mutated. In the face of fierce and resourceful tumor cells, the originally powerful immune cells seem to be unable and even turn a blind eye to some tumor cells. The immunosuppression formed in the tumor microenvironment makes the immune system paralyzed.

Question:
According to the above information, which of the following studies may contribute to the development of effective antitumor drugs?

Choices:
(A) Scientists compare the lifestyle and personality characteristics of patients with malignant tumors with those of healthy people to find out the risk factors inducing tumor incidence
(B) The researchers sequenced the DNA of tumor cells and healthy cells of each patient to identify tumor specific mutations and identify related abnormal proteins
(C) Scientists use immunotherapy to try to transform immune T cells that are indifferent to tumor cells and make them return to the battlefield
(D) Scientists used mice to test and injected the extracted tumor abnormal protein into mice as a vaccine to stimulate and enhance their immune response

Answer:
English.model_prediction:
The correct answer is (B) The researchers sequenced the DNA of tumor cells and healthy cells of each patient to identify tumor specific mutations and identify related abnormal proteins.

By sequencing the DNA of tumor cells and healthy cells of each patient, researchers can identify tumor specific mutations and identify related abnormal proteins that are involved in the development of cancer. This information can be used to develop targeted therapies that can inhibit the growth and spread of cancer cells.

Filipino.answer: (A) Inihambing ng mga siyentipiko ang mga katangian ng pamumuhay at personalidad ng mga pasyenteng may malignant na mga tumor sa mga malulusog na tao upang malaman ang mga kadahilanan ng panganib na nagdudulot ng insidente ng tumor
choices: (A) Inihambing ng mga siyentipiko ang mga katangian ng pamumuhay at personalidad ng mga pasyenteng may malignant na mga tumor sa mga malulusog na tao upang malaman ang mga kadahilanan ng panganib na nagdudulot ng insidente ng tumor

(B) Inayos ng mga mananaliksik ang DNA ng mga tumor cell at malusog na mga selula ng bawat pasyente upang matukoy ang mga partikular na mutasyon ng tumor at matukoy ang mga nauugnay na abnormal na protina.
(C) Gumagamit ang mga siyentipiko ng immunotherapy upang subukang baguhin ang mga immune T cells na walang malasakit sa mga selula ng tumor at ibalik ang mga ito sa mabuting kundisyon.

(D) Ginamit ng mga siyentipiko ang mga daga upang subukan at i-inject ang nakuhang tumor na abnormal na protina sa mga daga bilang isang bakuna upang pasiglahin at pahusayin ang kanilang immune response
Filipino.context: Dahil sa mutation ng gene, ang mga selula ay dumarami at hindi makontrol ang pagkakaiba, at kalaunan ay nagiging malignant na mga tumor. Maraming abnormal na protina na naka-encode sa mutant genes sa ibabaw ng mga selula ng kanser. Makatuwirang sabihin na ang mga abnormal na protinang ito ay dapat na makilala ng immune system ng katawan sa tamang panahon, at mag-trigger ng immune response upang tiyaking alisin ang mga selula ng kanser. Gayunpaman, dahil sa mabilis na pag-unlad ng mga selula ng tumor, ang mga ito ay napakahusay sa pagbabalatkayo, Bukod dito, ito ay patuloy na nagbabago. Sa harap ng mabangis at mapamaraang mga selulang tumor, ang orihinal na makapangyarihang mga selulang immune ay tila hindi kaya at pinag-wawalang bahala ang ilang mga selulang tumor. Ang immunosuppression na nabuo sa tumor microenvironment ay nakakalumpo sa immune system.

Spanish.answer: (A) Los científicos comparan el estilo de vida y las características de personalidad de pacientes con tumores malignos con los de personas sanas para descubrir los factores de riesgo que inducen la incidencia de tumores
choices: (A) Los científicos comparan el estilo de vida y las características de personalidad de pacientes con tumores malignos con los de personas sanas para descubrir los factores de riesgo que inducen la incidencia de tumores

(B) Los investigadores secuenciaron el ADN de las células tumorales y de las células sanas de cada paciente para identificar mutaciones específicas del tumor e identificar proteínas anormales relacionadas.
(C) Los científicos utilizan la inmunoterapia para intentar transformar las células T inmunes que son indiferentes a las células tumorales y hacerlas regresar al campo de batalla
(D) Los científicos utilizaron ratones para probar e inyectaron la proteína anormal del tumor extraída en ratones como vacuna para estimular y mejorar su respuesta inmune.
Spanish.context: Debido a la mutación genética, las células proliferan y se diferencian sin control y, finalmente, se convierten en tumores malignos. Hay muchas proteínas anormales codificadas por genes mutantes en la superficie de las células cancerosas. Es razonable decir que estas proteínas anormales deberían ser reconocidas por el sistema inmunológico del cuerpo a tiempo y desencadenar una respuesta inmune para eliminar las células cancerosas de una sola vez. Sin embargo, debido al rápido desarrollo de las células tumorales, son muy buenas para camuflarse y, además, mutan constantemente. Frente a las células tumorales feroces e ingeniosas, las células inmunes originalmente poderosas parecen incapaces e incluso hacen la vista gorda ante algunas células tumorales. La inmunosupresión formada en el microambiente del tumor paraliza el sistema inmunológico.

Chinese.answer: (A) 科学家将恶性肿瘤患者和健康人的生活方式,个性特征进行对照研究,找出诱发肿瘤发病的风险因素
choices: (A) 科学家将恶性肿瘤患者和健康人的生活方式,个性特征进行对照研究,找出诱发肿瘤发病的风险因素

(C) 科学家利用免疫疗法,试图改造对肿瘤细胞"不上心"的免疫T细胞,使其重返战场

Chinese.context: 细胞因为发生了基因突变,出现不受控制地增殖分化,最终发展成为恶性肿瘤.在癌细胞表面存在着许多由突变基因编码的异常蛋白,按理说,这些异常蛋白应该被机体免疫系统及时识别,并引发免疫反应将癌细胞一举清除.然而,由于肿瘤细胞发展迅速,极善伪装,而且不断突变,面对凶猛机智的肿瘤细胞,原本强大的免疫细胞也显得有些"力不从心",甚至还会对一些肿瘤细胞"视而不见".在肿瘤微环境中形成的免疫抑制,更是让免疫系统陷入"瘫痪".

Malay.answer: (A) Para saintis membandingkan gaya hidup dan ciri-ciri personaliti pesakit yang mempunyai tumor malignan dengan orang yang sihat untuk mengetahui faktor risiko yang menyebabkan kejadian tumor
choices: (A) Para saintis membandingkan gaya hidup dan ciri-ciri personaliti pesakit yang mempunyai tumor malignan dengan orang yang sihat untuk mengetahui faktor risiko yang menyebabkan kejadian tumor

Malay.context: Disebabkan oleh mutasi gen, sel membiak dan membeza secara tidak terkawal, dan akhirnya menjadi tumor malignan. Terdapat banyak protein abnormal yang dikodkan oleh gen mutan pada permukaan sel kanser. Có rất nhiều protein bất thường được mã hóa bởi các gen đột biến trên bề mặt tế bào ung thư. Thật hợp lý khi nói rằng những protein bất thường này phải được hệ thống miễn dịch của cơ thể nhận ra kịp thời và kích hoạt phản ứng miễn dịch để loại bỏ tế bào ung thư chỉ trong một lần đột quỵ. English.answer: (D) Without the support of large corporate sponsors, opera companies could not afford to produce any but the most famous of operas.

English.context: The high cost of production is severely limiting which operas are available to the public. These costs necessitate reliance on large corporate sponsors, who in return demand that only the most famous operas be produced. Determining which operas will be produced should rest only with ticket purchasers at the box office, not with large corporate sponsors. If we reduce production budgets so that operas can be supported exclusively by box-office receipts and donations from individuals, then the public will be able to see less famous operas.
English.question: Which one of the following, if true, would weaken the argument?
English.model_input:
Please answer the following multiple-choice question by selecting the correct option.

Context:
The high cost of production is severely limiting which operas are available to the public. These costs necessitate reliance on large corporate sponsors, who in return demand that only the most famous operas be produced. Determining which operas will be produced should rest only with ticket purchasers at the box office, not with large corporate sponsors. If we reduce production budgets so that operas can be supported exclusively by box-office receipts and donations from individuals, then the public will be able to see less famous operas.

Question:
Which one of the following, if true, would weaken the argument?

Choices:
(A) Large corporate sponsors will stop supporting opera productions if they are denied control over which operas will be produced.
(B) The reduction of opera production budgets would not reduce the desire of large corporate sponsors to support operas.
(C) A few opera ticket purchasers go to the opera for the sake of going to the opera, not to see specific operatic productions.
(D) Without the support of large corporate sponsors, opera companies could not afford to produce any but the most famous of operas.

Answer:
English.model_prediction: The correct answer is (C) A few opera ticket purchasers go to the opera for the sake of going to the opera, not to see specific operatic productions.

Filipino.answer: (D) Kung wala ang suporta ng malalaking corporate sponsors, ang mga kumpanya ng opera ay hindi kayang gumawa ng anuman maliban sa pinakasikat na mga opera.
choices: (A) Ang malalaking corporate sponsors ay titigil sa pagsuporta sa opera productions kung hindi nila makontrol kung aling mga opera ang gagawin.
(B) Ang pagbabawas ng mga badyet sa produksyon ng opera ay hindi makakabawas sa pagnanais ng malalaking corporate sponsor na suportahan ang mga opera.
(C) Ang ilang mga mamimili ng tiket sa opera ay pumunta sa opera para sa kapakanan ng pagpunta sa opera, hindi upang makita ang mga partikular na operatic productions.
(D) Kung wala ang suporta ng malalaking corporate sponsors, ang mga kumpanya ng opera ay hindi kayang gumawa ng anuman maliban sa pinakasikat na mga opera.
Filipino.context: Ang mataas na halaga ng produksyon ay lubhang nililimitahan kung aling mga opera ang magagamit sa publiko. Ang mga gastos na ito ay nangangailangan ng pag-asa sa malalaking corporate sponsors, na bilang kapalit ay humihiling na ang pinakasikat na mga opera lamang ang gawin. Ang pagtukoy kung aling mga opera ang gagawin ay dapat lamang magpahinga sa mga mamimili ng tiket sa takilya, hindi sa malalaking corporate sponsors. Kung babawasan natin ang mga badyet sa produksyon upang ang mga opera ay masuportahan lamang ng mga resibo mula sa box-office at mga donasyon mula sa mga indibidwal, ang publiko ay makakakita ng hindi gaanong sikat na mga opera.

Spanish.answer: (D) Sin el apoyo de grandes patrocinadores corporativos, las compañías de ópera no podían permitirse el lujo de producir más que las óperas más famosas.
choices: (A) Los grandes patrocinadores corporativos dejarán de apoyar las producciones de ópera si se les niega el control sobre qué óperas se producirán.
(B) La reducción de los presupuestos de producción de ópera no reduciría el deseo de los grandes patrocinadores corporativos de apoyar las óperas.
(C) Algunos compradores de entradas de ópera van a la ópera por el simple hecho de ir, no para ver producciones operísticas específicas.
(D) Sin el apoyo de grandes patrocinadores corporativos, las compañías de ópera no podían permitirse el lujo de producir más que las óperas más famosas.
Spanish.context: El alto coste de producción está limitando gravemente qué óperas están disponibles para el público. Estos costos exigen depender de grandes patrocinadores corporativos, quienes a cambio exigen que sólo se produzcan las óperas más famosas. La determinación de qué óperas se producirán debería recaer únicamente en los compradores de entradas en la taquilla, no en los grandes patrocinadores corporativos. Si reducimos los presupuestos de producción para que las óperas puedan sustentarse exclusivamente con ingresos de taquilla y donaciones de particulares, entonces el público podrá ver óperas menos famosas.

Malay.answer: (D) Tanpa sokongan penaja korporat yang besar, syarikat-syarikat opera tidak akan mampu menghasilkan apa-apa kecuali opera yang paling terkenal.
choices: (A) Penaja korporat yang besar akan berhenti menyokong produksi opera jika mereka dinafikan kata putus tentang opera mana yang akan diterbitkan.
(B) Pengurangan belanjawan penerbitan opera tidak akan mengurangkan keinginan penaja korporat besar untuk menyokong opera.
(C) Beberapa pembeli tiket opera pergi ke opera semata-mata untuk pergi ke opera, bukan untuk melihat produksi opera tertentu.
(D) Tanpa sokongan penaja korporat yang besar, syarikat-syarikat opera tidak akan mampu menghasilkan apa-apa kecuali opera yang paling terkenal.
Malay.context: Kos pengeluaran yang tinggi sangat mengehadkan opera mana yang tersedia untuk orang ramai. Kos ini menyebabkan perlunya kebergantungan kepada penaja korporat yang besar, yang sebaliknya akan menuntut bahawa hanya opera yang paling terkenal dihasilkan. Penentuan opera apa yang akan dihasilkan seharusnya bergantung hanya kepada pembeli tiket di tempat tiket, bukan kepada penaja korporat yang besar. Jika kita mengurangkan belanjawan pengeluaran supaya opera boleh disokong secara eksklusif oleh resit-resit tempat tiket dan derma daripada para individu, maka orang ramai akan dapat menyaksikan opera yang kurang terkenal.

Vietnamese.answer: (D) Nếu không có sự hỗ trợ của các nhà tài trợ doanh nghiệp lớn, các công ty opera không thể sản xuất bất kỳ vở opera nào ngoại trừ vở opera nổi tiếng nhất.

Vietnamese.context: Chi phí sản xuất cao đang hạn chế nghiêm trọng những vở opera nào được cung cấp cho công chúng. Những chi phí này đòi hỏi phải phụ thuộc vào các nhà tài trợ doanh nghiệp lớn, những người đổi lại yêu cầu chỉ sản xuất những vở opera nổi tiếng nhất. Việc xác định vở opera nào sẽ được sản xuất chỉ nên phụ thuộc vào những người mua vé tại phòng vé chứ không phải phụ thuộc vào các nhà tài trợ doanh nghiệp lớn. Nếu chúng ta giảm ngân sách sản xuất để các vở opera có thể được hỗ trợ hoàn toàn bằng doanh thu phòng vé và quyên góp từ các cá nhân, thì công chúng sẽ có thể xem những vở opera ít nổi tiếng hơn.

Indonesian.answer: (A) Menunjukkan faktor-faktor yang mempengaruhi efek pencitraan ponsel
choices: (A) Menunjukkan faktor-faktor yang mempengaruhi efek pencitraan ponsel
(B) Memperkenalkan teknik-teknik untuk meningkatkan efek fotografi ponsel
(C) Jelaskan definisi piksel dan cara membuatnya menjadi lebih baik
(D) Mengungkapkan hubungan antara jumlah cahaya yang masuk dan nilai piksel
Indonesian.context: Saat menilai fungsi kamera untuk sebuah ponsel, secara intuitif orang selalu percaya bahwa semakin tinggi piksel kamera ponsel, semakin baik efek kameranya. Apakah ini benar? Dari prinsip pencitraan, besar kecilnya nilai piksel akan mempunyai pengaruh tertentu terhadap gambar yang dihasilkan. Jika luas dari sensor gambar dari ponsel tertentu telah diketahui, semakin tinggi nilai pikselnya, semakin kecil luas satuan pikselnya. Luas satuan piksel secara langsung mempengaruhi jumlah cahaya yang masuk. Semakin kecil area satuan piksel, semakin sedikit cahaya yang masuk ke sensor gambar, dan foto yang diambil akan menjadi gelap dan buram; semakin rendah nilai pikselnya, semakin besar area fotosensitif piksel satuan dan semakin baik kinerja fotosensitifnya. Bagus, sehingga untuk memiliki performa yang lebih baik dalam sensitivitas tinggi kualitas gambar dan tingkat pencitraan gambar.

English.answer: (A) Point out the factors that affect the imaging effect of mobile phones
choices: (A) Point out the factors that affect the imaging effect of mobile phones
(B) Introduce techniques to improve the effect of mobile phone photography
(C) Explain the definition of pixel and how to improve it
(D) Reveal the relationship between the amount of incoming light and the pixel value
English.context: When judging the camera function of a mobile phone, people always intuitively believe that the higher the pixel of the mobile phone, the better the camera effect. Is this really the case? From the imaging principle, the size of the pixel value will have a certain influence on the generated image. When the image sensor area of the mobile phone is certain, the higher the pixel value, the smaller the unit pixel area. The unit pixel area directly affects the amount of light entering. The smaller the unit pixel area, the less light entering the image sensor, and the captured photos will become dark and blurry; the lower the pixel value, the larger the unit pixel photosensitive area and the better the photosensitive performance. Good, so it has better performance in terms of high-sensitivity image quality and picture level of imaging.
